text: Agnes Giebel (10 August 1921 - 24 April 2017) was a German classical soprano. She was born in Heerlen, the Netherlands. She studied at the Folkwang Hochschule in Essen and made her first public appearance as a singer in 1947. Her career lasted until the 1990s during which she established a wide-ranging discography. Giebel's career was based on the works of music such as cantatas, oratorios, passions, and masses and was thought to be one of the greatest Bach singers of her generation. Giebel died on 24 April 2017 in Cologne, Germany at the age of 95.Death of a Klemperer soprano, aged 95 ==References== ==Other websites== *Biography: contains photos and her Bach discography Category:1921 births Category:2017 deaths Category:German singers Category:People from Heerlen
title: Agnes Giebel
